abstract: President Obama will make his first public comments since the victory speech after his re-election. The president is expected to set the tone for upcoming talks on the so-called fiscal cliff. Come January, should Congress fail to act, the United States will face more than immense tax increases and spending cuts, Anne Lowry reported for The New York Times. Read more »
